review: I love to eat here. Great food and close to work. Always clean, staff is always helpful and   favorite food is their onion rings, blue cheese  burger.

We stop here occasionally for lunch as was the case today. This location seems to have much better service than the one on Arapahoe Rd. Wasn't busy when we got there at 1130 but 10 minutes later the place was packed. Our server was very energetic and our glasses were never dry(Huge plus ). Generally go here when I need a quick burger fix as they are always prepared the same and rarely any issues with the food. I like that they come out regularly with special burgers or sandwiches, etc...breaks up the monotony of a regular menu.

The sign out front letting you know there isnt a wait or how long of the wait is awesome. So you dont have to bug the Host(ess) to find out. I was quickly seated. And a server was right there. My Berry Lemonade never went empty. Had the salad with apples and walnuts. Fresh Veggies and the crunch from the walnuts were great with a sweet sauce. Topped it off with a Hot Fudge Sundae. And sat right by the TV screen.  They have Happy Hour Twice a day which is awesome.

We usually love going to Red Robin, as it's a great place to grab a quick burger and is perfect to go with kids.  However, tonight was the worst service we've ever had!  We wanted to go to the nearby PF Chang's, but the wait was 3 hours at 5:30!  So, we headed to this Red Robin.  We could tell from the beginning that our waitress was going to be lazy, and she definitely was.  She took our order and all was good, but she was not the one to bring out our food.  It was some other guy, who asked if we needed anything else.  My father-in-law asked for a drink refill, which was never refilled, until 15 minutes later when our actual waitress came over to check on us (and give us the check).  I got the mushroom burger, which is supposed to have a parmesan spread on it, but my burger was free of any sort of spread, so it was kind of dry.  However, I didn't feel like waiting for a new burger and no one was visible to ask.  I noticed that they give you about half the normal amount of fries now, which are supposed to be bottomless.  No one asked us if anyone wanted more fries.  I drank all my tea and could have used a refill, but our waitress never came back.  Then, I went to change my baby's diaper and in the handicap stall, where the changing table is, there was no hook on the back of the door to hang my diaper bag, which was very inconvenient.  Not to mention no one bothered to clean up the bathrooms before the dinner rush, so both trashcans were overflowing paper towels onto the floor, and the counters were very wet.  Additionally, the restrooms are placed horribly.  In order to avoid walking through the servers' work station, you have to walk around the whole perimeter of the restaurant and wind your way through the tables, where there really isn't much clearance between chairs if people are sitting in them.  Then, to top off the night, we had promised our 2 year old a balloon, if she behaved herself.  She did, so on our way out, we asked for a balloon.  The high school hostess said someone was filling balloons right now and it'd be about ten minutes, if we wanted to wait!  Yeah, right!  I felt like on a Saturday night at a restaurant that's filled with children, there should be a bunch of balloons, ready to hand out.  Overall, I was just really disappointed with the service at this Red Robin!  We will be avoiding this location next time we go shopping at Park Meadows.  No wonder there was no wait for a table!
Grilled chicken was tender and tasty, and the waitress was friendly and prompt. The menu offers healthy options for dieters too.

Staff would serve you while eating off there plates on break.  They had a whole section with staff eating. Having a good old time. While  Patrons waiting to be served.  Food not that great nothing special over priced burgers! Won't go back ever

Absolutely disgusting! After wiping down my son's highchair, I placed my wipe on the table. I started wiping some scum off the table and my wipe became black with filth muck that covered our table we were going to eat off of! I should have left right there and then but the management and staff moved quickly to scrub down another table and my kids were starving. The tables feel unclean to me and the manager mentioned they were going to be transitioning out the tables eventually. I will not be visiting again any time soon.  GROSS!

Came here early for lunch and there was only one other table seated so needless to say it was refreshingly quiet. The food was great and the waiter was super friendly and very helpful when it came to suggestions!

Quick service here.  The staff was really friendly.  I'd actually visited another Red Robin in Utah earlier in the week, and this one was probably comparably a little better.  The staff were faster here and I actually had the same meal at both locations.  The food was just slightly better here, although the fries were inconsistently seasoned.  They were either over-seasoned or under-seasoned.  The drink refills were fast and I never once had to ask for one.  That's a HUGE plus in my books. The price for lunch + tip was $17.  I didn't get a great value for $17, which is why I don't dine at Red Robin very often.  But, a 3-star review is too harsh and there's no chance for a 5-star.  So this is a low 4-star review in my books.

Okay, i loved, loved, loved, LOVED Red Robin. They used to be my favorite burgers. But, last time we went here it was NOT the patty I have come to know and love. Thin and dry and sub-level. The management was quick to get a hold of me, as I tweeted RR and asked if they switched their patties. Their reply was yes, and I am forever bummed.

Awful. I keep trying it because of my nephews. This place is terrible. Someone gave RED ROBIN 5 stars? Where do you normally eat, Taco Bell? If you have allergies beware of this place. They bring out a menu and say you can order from this then they put what you are allergic to ON the food.

First off, i really like Red Robin and their food. That said, this location does OK with customer service. Unfortunately during my last visit, we were informed that they would no longer provide 'bottomless fries' before our main entree came out --- unless we wanted to pay an extra $2.50. While I understand that the bottomless fries do cannibalize their appetizer sales, the delivery of the message from our server was horrible.

The service here was AWFUL. About 5 customers in the restaurant and it took over 5 minutes to even be acknowledged. After being seated, our glasses were extremely dirty. We would try ti wipe of thee dirty, but the residue would just smear. After complaining to the manager, he never said sorry. Instead, he gave us to - go glasses. After receiving the bill, we asked to have our check split. There were 2 of us.. our waitress had no other table. She rolled her eyes at us and returned about 5 minutes later. After putting money in the check holder, it took about 15 minutes for her to return to get our money. Never got a thank you for coming in. I will NEVER go back to this Red Robin and I am a fan of Red Robin.

Sorry to read about the other poor experiences. Our server Christie Davis, who was new, was awesome. Readily available without being annoying, she was ready with a sweet smile and fairly quick to fulfill our requests and even made great recommendations. Hubby goes through his sodas like they're tiny glasses, but our server came by with brand new, fresh glasses of soda whenever she noticed his was 3/4 empty. That is a great server.    Our food was very well-prepared and the presentation was terrific. The French fries were perfectly cooked and seasoned, the burgers juicy and tasty. Very enjoyable.   What I did NOT like was the dirtiness of the light over our table and everything above that level was dusty. The open ductwork, while cool to behold, had several months worth of dust piled up. Thus the one less star.

I have always had solid Red Robin burgers at this location over the years.  They can get quite busy at times.  Service is generally good.  It was less good on my most recent visit.  They were not especially busy, but the server disappeared and it took quite a while to get the check.  My fries were good, but not as good as they could have been. Similary to Correy H., I also have been disappointed that most of the Red Robins seem to have adopted the "no fries before your meal" policy (unless you pay extra).  Although I understand the logic (they are trying to sell more apps, and reduce the amount of uneaten fries), this seems like irritatingly needless penny pinching.  I am already paying over $10 for a burger and "bottomless" (supposedly) fries, add $3 for a soda, and we are easily into $16 (with tax and tip) land.  This assumes you did not order an appetizer, beer, milkshake, etc.  I very much prefer eating my fries piping hot as part of the communal experience before the burger arrives.  Eating my 7 (yes, I counted) cold fries after I have consumed my burger is significantly less satisfying.

I don't get it. Their famousf plank fries were cold AND STALE?!?! How does that happen. I thought it was my imagination, but my lunch  buddy reached the same conclusion without me even mentioning t to me. When I complained, we got a new basket of fries, same issue!  On the third try, the server announced, "THEY JUST CAME OUT OF THE FRYER!!" They were barely lukewarm. I'm thinking cold oil and old fries? YUK.
I love this Red Robin!  The service was awesome.  We had Sabastian as our waiter and he was funny, friendly and very attentive.  The food was great as well.

I stopped here to fuel up at lunch before a day of shopping at Park Meadows and was rather pleased with the whole experience. The hostess and our waitress were both very nice, and our waitress was perfectly attentive throughout our meal. I got a Boca vegan burger with sweet potato fries and the presentation and taste were both above my only other Red Robin experience in Texas. Overall, it was a quick, tasty, pleasant lunch experience! I'd consider coming back during another visit to Park Meadows.

With 2 kids who love the menu, it really sucks to go to this franchise expecting what you have had before. This time the whole experience was awful. The greeter couldn't have been more inappropriate, the table needed a hot washing, then the meal came out wrong and cold. The human resource manager hired the entire store wrong.

What a joke. We walk in and they say 40 min wait and shame on us for waiting. I look around and half the restaurant is empty. So either the place is very poorly ran or everyone is still hung over from Saturday night. Then I confront the hostess to hear that they are under staffed mean while the manager pipes in and says we aren't understaffed just cleaning tables off for our next guest. Bull. There were at least 20 tables emptied and ready to go. Now 45 minutes later I am still wondering why we decided to stay and still are waiting for "tables to be cleaned off" The rest of the service was Good! We got our food in a timely fashion and the manager came over and gave us a free appetizer to apologize. He said he was sorry for the wait and he wanted to make sure we had a good experience. Well they did good just handle that wait time a little better and it will be 5 stars! Red Robbin....... Yümmmmm.

Only real disappointment was how long it took the waitress to take our order. Not sure if she had a lot of tables or was just not on her game. Tried a new drink, cherry lime flip, which was delicious. Banzai burger is always my favorite, delicious pairing of teriyaki sauce and pineapple. Wish they still wrapped their burgers in paper, would make for a less messy eating experience. Fries were good as usual but portions are smaller now. Perfect for me since I never finish them but my boyfriend polished off mine since our waitress never asked if he wanted more. Would have ordered dessert if the service had been better.

The food is OK.  Little inconsistent but OK.  The service, on the other hand, is terrible!  Three times now we have had three different waitresses, who are very young and dumb.  Can't remember anything you tell them.  It takes forever to even get a drink. They need to choose better,  more competent people, for their wait staff.

Rarely do I ever like spending over $10 for a meal let alone at a chain restaurant. Red Robin is one of the few exceptions. Food is great unless you're coming here to order a plain burger and fries (you can get that at 5 guys). The menu is ever changing and the created burgers never disappoint. Not to mention killer milkshakes...sometimes the straw just doesn't cut it. I would avoid this place around dinner time since it turns into Romper Room. Also, don't sit in the bar area unless you plan on sitting directly at the bar, since the service tends to be slack.

Not a big fan of this place.  The fries are good.  Our server brought us a plate while we waited for our other party.  By the time I snacked on a few and drank my diet coke I was full.  However I did get a cup of onion soup and house salad.  Soup was just ok.  The cheese was tougher than usuaul and the broth was not very tasty.  The chicken burger looked ok as did the chicken wrap.  i think it is expensive for what you get.  Much prefer other burger joints to this even though I did not have a burger.  Maybe I would have.

I love the bottomless fries except they aren't really bottomless because you have to constantly ask for more. My experience here have been different, not in a horrible way. One time the waiter was helpful and would check on is a little bit here and there, but just last week I had an awesome experience with our waiter, JJ. He was all smiles and very cheery. It made things better and he would check on us consistently and made sure everything was refilled. Food is great. I love the guacamole bacon burger, my go to burger, but this time I got the teriyaki chicken burger, similar to the banzai burger except with chicken, not beef. The pineapple was tender and made a good balance of sweet and salty.

I've been to this location twice, and both times the same issue(s) arose. By the way, the theme is "crappy service," and yes, I had different servers each time. 1) never refills beverages 2) never offers to refill your "bottomless" fries 3) takes 15 minutes on average to get said refill "bottomless" fries, not including the time it takes to flag down your server 4) takes forever to deliver the bill The overall taste of the burgers is just average and doesn't compensate for the horrible service. I'm forced to move on.
Struggles to meet pretty low expectations, from sticky tables, having to ask for silverware to overpriced fare. Kids made the call to go; as they get older surely they'll gain better judgement.
Clean lace to have lunch or dinner. Good service with a friendly staff. The location is good too after you eat can walk to the mall and do a bit of retail therapy.

I have yet to have a bad meal here.  Love the Whiskey River BBQ salad!  The sliced grilled chicken with the signature BBQ sauce on a bed of chopped lettuce, corn, black beans, onion straws, cheese & colorful tortilla strips, topped with just the right amount of dressing is absolutely delish!  It's light enough for a late evening meal, but substantial enough to fill the tummy.        My favorite burgers so far are the Whiskey River BBQ burger & the Bonzai Burger--so far!!!  Look forward to trying more in the future.

IF YOU HAVE A WHEAT ALLERGY DO NOT EAT HERE. I ordered a burger wrapped in lettuce, due to the fact I cannot eat wheat. When it came out, the burger had a wheat bun on it. I told the server I couldn't have it, so she took it back to the kitchen. When it came back, I examined it and noticed there was still parts of the bun stuck to the cheese! That is just dangerous to do to people. This is the worst Red Robin I've ever been to. Not only was the service terrible, the servers were rude, the silverware was dirty, there are BUGS, and they did not respect my allergies. Never again will I go back here, especially when most burger places now are nearly the same price, with better burgers. Save yourself the trouble and disappointment and go to somewhere that makes good food and has better service.

Actually have not been to a Red Robbin in a long time but stopped by this location for lunch.  Pleasantly surprised!  I had grilled chicken salad and husband had French dip.  Both meals very good and service was very quick/friendly.  Really I have no complaints and there was a lot of options on the menu.  We will be back
Not sure why we can never get good service at this place.  Extremely slow and very unprofessional.

Ugh. Honestly the only reason we visited this Red Robin is because the last time I was at a Red Robin they messed everything up and gave me a gift card to come back. I don't understand how Red Robin can say they have such good burgers. The patty was dry, the bun even drier. The server brought the wrong menu item for Robin and then argued with her, even after we demonstrated how she got it wrong. No sense in even fighting the overcharge on the bill. Just get us the heck out of here and to a Smashburger, for heaven's sake.

I'd rather buy a sandwich from 7-11 than eat here again. Not even if they gave out free food and actually cleaned the table. Nothing was right about this experience.  The waitress messed up my order, then blew it off when I questioned her about it.  They even messed up Karen's burger.  Kind of hard to mess up a burger but they managed to do it.   Even worse, the staff uses the handicapped bathroom stall as a changing room.  Both times I went in to the women's room, one of them was in there.  Not what you want to see going on when you have a 93 yo who needs to get in.  Not to mention, if you are in a wheel chair or on or a scooter, you won't be able to get out without someone to hold the door for you. Horrible experience all the way around.

We've stopped going to Red Robin in the last year at both the Highlands Ranch and Park Meadows locations because of generally slow service and consistently and inexplicable sticky/dirty tables and floors.   At 7PM on a Friday night the "immediate seating available" sign should have sent us a clear warning - but we were committed.   Guess what? One year later nothing's changed.  Two years ago there was always a wait on a Friday night.  They seem to have lost sight of the service basics and everyone knows.   We won't be back.

The Red Robin on Arapahoe Rd is near us and we have eaten there on occasion for many years. We thought the food was good. The service can range from excellent to so-so. We recently went there again and are wondering why they changed up the décor.  It is dark and depressing with lots of beer bottles hanging from the ceililng  . . . how do they clean those? Well actually some are dusty and there are tables with people eating right under them in the bar area. We had no complaints about the food. However our waiter got my order mixed up and I had to wait quite awhile for a new plate. We do love the burgers and sweet potato fries. Also the Cobb salad is very good. Regarding the décor - bring back the way it was ... there is something to be said about tradition.

I think I will find a different Red Robin to go to from now on. Always have had varied service- either good or really bad! Last visit did it for me. Went during a lunch hour with my husband. There was hardly anyone there and yet it took them forever to get around to us. When we finally ordered they completely messed up my husbands meal. He asked for cajun clucks and fries - they brought a chicken sandwich... how they mess that up no clue.This was even after he clearly stated that it was the chicken fingers tossed in buffalo sauce. THEN the manager came over to clarify what he wanted. After about 8 minutes they brought him the right meal BUT the chicken was completely raw inside! Disgusting!! So we ended up just leaving after that. They comped his meal but not mine (which I think they should've since it ruined our lunch.)  Needless to say, I think we are done with this location. We can find another one or a good burger somewhere else. Very disappointed.

After the Broncos game, we decided to meet another couple for dinner at Red Robin.  We had been there before and had generally positive experiences, but unfortunately not on this trip. Since we showed up AFTER the game, the restaurant was mostly empty but we still barely saw our server.  Evidently they had a shortage on the "bottomless" fries.  The first round had been sitting around for at least a half hour (they were very stale).  When we asked for another round, there were literally 8 fries in the basket....to share among 4 people.  On the plus side, the burgers were exactly as ordered and very tasty.   All in all, good burgers but lousy fries and mediocre service.  We've usually had better success at the Parker & Arapahoe location, so I would suggest that location over the Park Meadows restaurant if given the choice.

While the food tasted good, the service was as minimal as a the grilling of a raw burger. Things that happened: (4 orders placed) -never received ordered waters (asked twice) -wrong salad dressing  -another dish didn't come with ordered dressing, asked and waited 7 minutes -entirely wrong order arrived (ordered BLT on a croissant with fries and received a cheeseburger with onion rings) -receipt came with the wrong items listed per above misorder I confronted the manager about the service to give him a chance to correct the subpar service and he was standoffish and generally rude. Nothing was remedied. Service was slow, manager gave us sass...not worth it.

The Whiskey River BBQ Chicken Wrap is absolutely amazing. How did I get so lucky to get Julie as my server again? I must be the luckiest guy in the world! After a long day at work it's great to grab a one of their beers on tap and fill up with great food! Always leave satisfied!

One of the worst dining experiences I have ever had!  The waitress was SO rude and she totally messed up our order.  We had our 3 little kids with us and when I asked her to get the stuff she forgot my wife and I could totally hear here cussing to her fellow employees in back.  It was so unprofessional I couldn't believe it.  Even worse on the receipt it asks to let them know how they are doing so I went online and told them everything.  They texted me that a manager would call me within 2 days.  Well, that never happened.  As a business owner and former server in a high end steak house I would roll over in my grave if i knew I had employees treating my customers like this.  Apparently at the corporate level they could care less because they have so much volume.  I will say that I have been to many Red Robins and they are much better than this one!

Let me start by saying I love a good burger and a cold beer.  I also want to say that Red Robin is usually at the top of my list. But this time... We should have went elsewhere.  My son loves the Tavern double but said the Parker Red Robin tastes better.  I have to agree. Why? I don't know. It just didn't taste as good. I'll definitely drive an extra 10 minutes to eat in Parker. Oh, and service here does not live up to Park Meadow standards...slow and slower and slowest.

good food always but you will be waiting soooo long! unlimited french fries wont happen, they are very slow, alot of the times rude, the managers dont care about the bad service , just not even worth it

I'm surprised this place gets rated so low. My family and I have always had a good experience at this location. And yes, it is a chain blah blah blah. However there's no denying that they make some very tasty burgers. Their bar is fully stocked and the service is usually average to good. The food comes out fast, hot and delicious. I gave this place 5 stars to help up their rating.

My experiences at this red robin have always been great. We get great and fast service every time. Last time I went I was with my family. The waitress kept bringing french fries for us until our food came which we thought was nice. We never had to ask for a refill she was always on it. I ordered the royal burger and I though my egg was just a bit too funny. Was impossible to eat without getting yolk dripping down my arm. My sister ordered Mac n cheese and it tasted like in came from the box and was really runny. Besides that I would recommend this location.

My friends and I came here last Sunday for an early dinner before heading to the Pepsi Center for a concert. I hadn't been to a Red Robin in years, but I love a good burger, so I was looking forward to it. However, it seems the food has really gone downhill at Red Robin. They've (recently?) redesigned their menu and added a lot of appetizers, pared down the burgers while adding a few new ones, and kind of toned down the whole "kiddie heaven" vibe (fine by me!). We started with the Pretzel Bites, and well, they were quite disappointing. The bites themselves tasted like those you can buy in the freezer section and cook in your oven at home, and the beer cheese sauce? It tasted like Cheez-Whiz with some beer stirred in. Gross. I ordered the Whiskey River BBQ Burger, as I remembered liking it in the past. It was okay, but tasted like a drive thru burger. Thankfully I ordered it with a side salad because the fries I stole off of a friend's plate tasted stale and unappetizing (and they were hot, so I'm pretty sure they were "fresh"). I only ate about 1/2 my burger and felt disappointed when I paid my bill -- $16 for a very, very mediocre burger and appetizer and a glass of water. All told, $20 with the tip for a meal that I could have gotten for $10 at a drive thru and probably would have enjoyed more. The food deserved one star, however, our server was pretty awesome. He was super friendly and attentive, plus he put up with some bad jokes from us (sorry, bud!), so he earned the extra star here. A plus for groups: this restaurant has that nifty pay-at-the-table device (I don't remember what it's called, but Chili's has something similar). You can pay when you're ready and it makes it a cinch to split the bill up, if you need to!

Raw chicken. They actually served chicken fingers that were raw. Even worse, when shown the issue (which can kill you) they offered $3 off. 3 whole dollars. I could not believe it. No, 'We are so sorry' or anything like that. Honestly, they should have comped the table. I guess since we had a large party it was just to much.  I cannot believe I ate here again. It was my nephews birthday, so that is why I went. His choice. This is supposedly the flag ship store. The corporate office is just across the highway. I know the execs come in every once in a while. They must wear big bright neon signs so they get the best service and food.  I tried the Ghost Pepper Burger. It was suppose to have deep fried and fresh peppers. Nope, not mine. No deep fried peppers. It was basically a dry burger with little flavor. Another sad attempt to make something really great.  After my last review, I was contacted by a manager of this fine establishment. I did not respond. To the manager who is reading this, please do not try and contact me. I do not want free food or coupons. All I want is for you to do better. Not just for me, but for all those unfortunate souls who stumble in to your establishment. I hope to never be back. I know my nephew and his friends will veto your restaurant if the recommendation comes up.

They have stuff on the menu they no longer serve. Our waitress darn near thru the drink refill at my husband. My daughter's food was wrong. I sent  it back just to have a new colder plate of pasta given to us. The area was not clean and they were under staffed.

I keep giving this chain a shot at different locations because I used to like it. Here, I got the fried chicken salad and it was OK. There was a fly in my water. The table and menu needed a good cleaning. A person I was with had to wait for his fries and was told they ran out? My strawberry lemonade wasn't good so I got a regular lemonade and that also wasn't good. They were out of TP in the bathroom stall. Everything is overpriced. You even have to pay $2 to access trivia questions. The best part of the meal was the mud pie ice cream dessert. I like the little computer that you can order and pay on but that doesn't save it from a bad review.

Here is the text I just sent to Red Robin's HQ, though who knows whether they will take the time to take any action. I cannot recommend that you spend your good money with this location as the manager is unable to get the kitchen to prepare what's described on the menu, and if you get the server we got, they'll challenge you for asking if they brought the right product (even when it's not), they'll forget your drinks to serve a larger, later arriving party ("I got slammed" is what they must be taught to say, instead of I'm sorry how can I fix the situation?"), the table-top checkout device will spit out a blank receipt, and a conversation with the manager will provide only a "That shouldn't happen" reaction without a clue of how to deal with any issues. Sad. Very sad. What was left on the RR customer service web site today: So many things wrong its hard to know where to start. Dined tonight (July 4th) at table #93 at the Lone Tree store. Service was worse than poor and the manager had no clue how to deal with it when brought to her attention at our departure. Family of 4 dining, with father paying - and this is mostly the father's (payee's) feedback based upon his meal. Incomplete meal brought to table: Red Tavern Big Turbo brought to table as plain burger with only pepperjack cheese (no special sauce, no carmelized onions). Server challenged (clueless on how to match product to food delivered) but took it back to kitchen to fix. Brought it back out - now cold - with onions thrown on top. Also not impressed that RR charges $1.80 more for a bigger burger size when all that really happens is that a double burger becomes a thin single burger. Misleading. Server then promised to being more drinks which never happened. When this was later mentioned to him he shrugged it off saying a bigger table subsequently came in and he got slammed. No offer to take any action at all, which turns out to be the same approach his manager took when we walked to see her...after our tableside checkout terminal printed us a blank receipt (no one knows how to fix that either). Overall, RR leaves a customer with a don't give a sh&t attitude, with employees so poorly trained they cannot prepare or deliver food correctly, provide good service or deal with their own ineptitude when it arrises. No wonder this property lacked many customers.

I liked the variety of sauces and the bottomless fries. The campfire sauce is delicious. We ordered an onion ring tower and the onion rings were crispy and delicious. The burger i had was good but i wasn't blown away. All in all a good experience but you are paying a above average price for what you are getting. It tastes good but there are places i would chose over it.

Decided to stop by here with the wife for a pre-seminar dinner. I ordered the ghost pepper burger (not terribly spicy) and my wife just got a normal red robin burger. The burgers here have a thing about them that are just better than most places, not sure what it is. the food was very good, its just a normal burger joint, nothing too special. They do have those handy touch screens to check out if you're in a hurry though, I think of lot of chain sit down restaurants are starting to do this. Our waitress was very nice (sorry I forgot her name) tall blonde girl, and was very attentive to my food allergy, I appreciated that a lot. Overall a good place to grab an interesting burger.

Food poisoning!  My step son ordered a burger there last night with "no pink", and it was served very rare.  Then he vomited all night from from what we assume was a botchelism burger.  Used to really like Red Robin.  Stay away...for your own health!
Would give it zero stars if I could. Worst burger I've ever had. Disgusting food. Decent service, but doesn't really matter if you serve crappy food.
Love this place.  Great food, nice gluten free options, and solid service.  One of our main go-to restaurants in the Lone Tree area.

Walked in. No greeter. Peeked in the bar for a greeter...saw an employee sitting in a booth. Waited some more...nothing. Walked right out with the family and enjoyed a meal across the way instead. Dissatisfied.

I have to say this location has gotten a lot better from a customer service stand point and an operations standpoint I work in the restaurant industry its very evident that there's been a management change and a good one at that. Most people use this site for bad feedback but this manager and staff deserves praise. P.s. The foods better than it's ever been at a red robin.

The food was cold and not so great but our server was professional and attentive. I always get the whiskey river bbq burger and I don't think it was cooked all the way. Not too impressed with this location.

Had surprisingly poor quality tonight. Overlooking little missteps made by our wait staff, we still had one order wrong (twice), a side not show up (until the manager did), and found hair in another order. We went to this location because the one further west had three one star reviews this week. Seems like this location isn't doing much better. The frustration led us to a Mad Greens down the street so we could get a meal for the person whose order never showed up right. Their employee overheard us discussing the experience and gave us a free salad!

My family had lunch there to celebrate a birthday on 9/25/16. Food was what we typically expect from Red Robin (Don't get the Clam Chowder) which is usually abe. Although as we departed the restaurant my son left his expensive Carbon fiber Ray Ban sunglasses on the table in their case accidentally. When we realized 10 minutes later, and called the restaurant and then returned to the location. Low and behold, sunnglasses were nowhere to be found. The table was tucked in to the corner and it's extremely unlikely that anyone besides the staff would of seen them sitting there. The manager was no help and was defensive. So if you value your personal items be careful at this location. The staff had sticky fingers and the manger couldn't care less.

For the burgers, Red Robin always scores an A+. They score an F on fresh fries. I've been here 3 times in 30 days and every time the fries come to the table, they're cold. It then takes 5 mins or more to get the server's attention.  RR used to have an impressive training program, but it seems to be a reduced effort ever since their attempted rebranding strategy. When "bottomless fries" is so stressed, they should do a better job checking in. At a minimum, serve them hot.

They are quiet busy, had their vegan Boca burger and fries. Love the way the burger buns are grilled, it is crispy on the inside and soft on the outside.The service is good, gotta try their Milkshakes sometime.

I usually order my meal to go since service is hit or miss but I was very pleased on my last visit.   My friends complain about the prices, but a typical burger joint will run you $10-$12 with fries and the upside to Red Robin is that the fries are bottomless and the ranch dressing runs freely throughout the restaurant.   I had the fried chicken sandwich with a sweet waffle bun which was awesome and opposite of what I usually order (fish and chips).  The chicken sandwich was topped with lettuce, tomato, a jalapeño relish and a honey glaze.  It was a perfect complement of sweet and spicy, though messy and had to be eaten with a knife and fork.   During the holidays, the gingerbread milkshake is a must!   Check them out if you're near Park Meadows and want a quick meal with the family.
Amazing service! We did show up late on a Sunday night, but we were given full attention by our waiter, Gene, who made it a wonderful experience.

We went here for lunch today while on our lunch break from work. We arrived at 11:40, ordered right away and the food took 40 minutes to arrive. We had to tell the food runner that we needed to go boxes as we needed to get back to work as the food took a long time. The food runner then tells us its not her fault. We didn't say "it was her fault"....so we attempted to eat a few bites real quick and everything was cold! We asked for the manager who came out with excuses like the kitchen is short staffed. We told him the food was cold and he told us that our food was sitting in the window for awhile. Well why didn't the manager run our food out??? Not to mention where was our server? He comped our meal and asked us to come back. Not sure I will as eating cold food turned me off from going back.

Never had a problem with this chain. I've come here at least once a month for years, and I don't know if I've ever had a complaint. Every time the server asks me how my food was, the only answer I can think of is, "I'm sad that it's over." Maybe I'm just easy to please but I highly recommend this Red Robin over any other in the area.

Consistently good service and food.  I always order the Blue Ribbon Burger with veggie patty.  It's nice to be able to enjoy a vegetarian meal at a burger joint.  The kids meal is a great value.  My daughter loves the mac n cheese and it's nice they will provide a refill if she wants more.  A great place that appeases the whole family.

My husband and I eat here often enough the servers recognize us.  That being said, the food at this location is always hot, fresh and tasty, and we almost always have REALLY great service.  Recently we decided to try the RR location off Broadway and C-470, and our service was terrible, our burgers were raw in the middle despite the fact that we ordered them well done/no pink. It was a terrible experience. We won't be back to that location. A week later, we're back to the RR at Park Meadows, and the food was excellent and cooked to perfection, we had the best waitress we've had at any restaurant in ages, and we were happy to back at this location where food and service is always consistent!  Keep up the good work!

Went in for the $6.99 burger and was surprised that it was really good. This portion size is actually perfect so that I am not eating too much. They always have good and fun people to serve you. Also tried the melted cheese sandwich.

Food was decent, a typical Red Robin. The service though was terribly slow. Everyone at our table had already drank their entire beverage before we were able to place our order (except for the one child, whose drink was forgotten). I love the fact the offer endless fries, which helps when the kids are starving, but only if they are brought before you have been there an hour. They also offer refills on the kids mac and cheese, but again, by the time you get them the kids have lost interest.

This chain has gone completely down hill.  It used to be our favorite place for burgers.  The food is still decent however the service is horrendous and terribly slow.  Every time we leave we swear that we won't go back.  Two months later we will get sucked back in hoping things will change and it never does. We experience this at any location we go to and there are three by our house.  I think this chain has morphed into the usual corporate abyss of bad management and no customer focus.

I have never been to red Robin before but I was really wanting a burger after seeing all of their commercials on television so I decided to stop in and give them a try one afternoon. I did not realize that their entire menu is just hamburgers and sandwiches. I was expecting more options like salads and other bar type foods but I was shocked to see that it really was just burgers and sandwiches. Since I wanted a burger I was good to go and I ordered a pretty delicious burger overall it was cooked just the way I liked it and asked for and it came out in about 10 minutes. They say that they have bottomless fries but they really don't give you much to start with they only give you a small handful of french fries. So you will definitely want to be ordering more if you are a french fry fiend like I am.  The service here is all right. A lot of it has become automated with the check out right at your table so there is less interaction with your server than there is at a number of other restaurants. This has its pros and cons but I'll let you decide if that's the kind of place you want to dine at.  Overall it was an OK experience. The booths were a little bit sticky and the table had a weird patina on the top like it had just been wiped off for 15 years instead of ever properly cleaned. It was an all right burger but I don't think that's enough to bring me back to this particular red Robin. Maybe I'll give another location to try in a few years.

Red Robin has the best fish and chips!!! My boyfriend and I visited on Wednesday, the 21st of June, and had a lovely  dinner. Our server, Chris was awesome. The manager also checked on us and we had plenty of soda and water to drink and fries. We only go out to eat once in a while and this was a great experience!!!
Veggie burger was very tasty and chicken platter was good too. Quick service and attentive staff.
Great burger. Came out exactly like I ordered it. It seems that doesn't happen all the time. The waiter was good and kept my drink full.

It hurts me to give Red Robin only 2 stars as I've generally been a fan but I was not impressed.  They started out by taking way too long to get us a table.  It's a Friday night and there were plenty of open tables but the hostesses were more consumed with chit chatting with each other.  It was rather obvious they were in no rush.  Next was the rather slow service.  I'd say they need more waiters.   A good portion of their menu is various forms of hamburgers.  I'd say this seems to be their "specialty"  The pictures on their menu have these huge juicy patties.  I ordered their Spicy Siracha burger...with some pink.  When it came it was a patty about the thickness of a McDonalds burger and was charred with no pink at all.  If burgers are your specialty, then please learn how to cook them and don't skimp on the meat.   It seems to me that Red Robin has a big name and a pretty good reputation.  Seems like they're happy enough with that and don't worry about the little things like service and quality of food.  Too bad.

Well things change and then they change back again... Decided to grab a bite at this red Robin before we caught the light rail to go see a Rockies game. We were greeted when we walked in.....well, we weren't really greeted when we walked in. The guy had his face engulfed in some menus walked us to our seats and then said someone will be with us shortly. We sat at the table for a few minutes and no waiter so we decided to move to the bar. The bartender was quick in getting us our drinks and when our appetizer came we had no silverware. I decided I would get it myself. The bartender saw me get up to go get it but also didn't say anything to me when he brought us our food. The manager also saw me going to get silverware and asked me where I was sitting. No one ever came back to check on this. I believe it all starts from management and manager was clearly aware of what was going on but chose to do nothing. My girlfriend said there's no toilet paper in the bathroom. I learned a long time ago that people go where they're invited and return where they're welcomed. We definitely were not welcomed!

The last time I was here was in October 2017.  Now, I think their portion sizes have gotten smaller.  I ordered my mushroom burger to-go but the patty and bun were smaller than I remember and there weren't enough mushrooms on it.  Plus, I asked for "no pink" for the meat and it came out dry.  I think $11 plus for a burger and fries is pretty steep.

OK, disclaimer: I'm a fried chicken sandwich guy.  If I haven't been to your establishment yet, I'm going to order a classic fried chicken sandwich, and I'm going to judge your entire business based on that sandwich.  So guess what Round Robin? You got five stars! That was the best fried chicken sandwich I can remember having in recent memory. I wish there was a round robin in my hometown. I will be back next time I'm in Denver Tech Center!  The staff was quite friendly too :)

Red Robin used to have delicious food and a fun atmosphere. Well, this is not true for this location. We were sat fairly quickly however we then had to wait about 10 minutes for some ice water. Then we asked for a glass of white zin and they say they don't have it. We order a moscotto and again they don't have it.  The drink orders took about 20 minutes and we are thankful we asked for a water! We skip the wine and now we order an appetizer of ships and salsa as we wait for the food we are ordering. After another half an hour they bring out the chips and guacamole and salsa as well as the hamburgers. We asked that the guac and chips be taken back and they comped it out( the guacamole was brown).  The manager never came to our table but did comp the salsa and give us a friend and family discount of 25%. I tipped Christina the waitress well as she tried her best, I don't feel this was her fault. It seemed to be poorly managed. The staff all seemed to be working extremely hard. We probably won't go back to this specific location.
I went in to the restaurant sat at the bar area for 10 minutes and nobody came up to wait on me. So I left.

I don't typically seek out Red Robin, but I was craving some steak fries with a side of ranch. Called ahead and spoke with Carmen. She took my order and her phone etiquette was text book perfect. She was kind and confirmed everything over the phone. I went in to pick up my order and she helped me inside and was even more kind in person! 5stars for Carmen. And my food was great as well.

I used to be a fan of Red Robin.  No longer.  First of all....the burgers have gotten really thin.  They used to be thicker, juicier, tastier.  They give less fries now too. But my biggest complaint is that they go to great pains to ask how you want your burger cooked. we both said medium to well, no pink please.  Both of our burger were very pink....hard to do when so thin. Must have barely touched the grill on each side.  This is the third time.  So not just a one time mistake.  We were hungry so we ate, and when the server came by when we were more than halfway done. We showed him, but since we ate half already we didn't send them back.  He came by at the end to tell us he told the cook. No comping the drinks, or offer of more fries or anything.  Just not as good as it used to be, and I resent being given a skinny burger when it used to be much thicker and juicier.  Better places.

I love Red Robin and this one is one of the better ones to go to. They are always so nice here and they check on you all the time to make sure you are doing alright. the server we had was so sweet and she always made sure we had a full drink and if we wanted more fries or not. they always seat you super quick to and always know what's going on in the restaurant.  I had the burger with the ghost chili sauce on it and was a little disappointed because it was not spicy at all really and if it was a ghost chili sauce then i wanted it to make me sweat, but alas it was not. It was still delicious though and this is one of my favorite chains to get a burger at. the fries here also never disappoint and are always mouthwatering good. That is one of the things I love about Red Robin, the endless fries. I also love the way they do their buns. they grill them so its crispy on the bottom and the top is nice and soft. I will definitely be coming back soon to get my fill.

I went to Red Robin today. We waited 30 minutes for french fries. We ordered veggie burgers and after the 30 minute wait, they told us they ran out of veggie burgers. It was a very disappointing experience.
